definition: toy/plaything/thing/act/trick (in a performance, stage show, acrobatics etc)
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
erhua variant of 玩意[wan2 yi4]

sentences.english: I have a job interview in an hour and none of it is coming off.
sentences.chinese: 我一个小时以后要去面试，这些玩意怎么也洗不掉。

sentences.english: That's because people want fancy new gadgets now.
sentences.chinese: 因为人们现在喜欢新奇的小玩意。

sentences.english: We've decorated the Christmas tree with plenty of tinsel and baubles.
sentences.chinese: 我们用很多亮亮的东西和小玩意来装饰圣诞树。

sentences.english: There’s this new thing called a jet bridge.
sentences.chinese: 有这么个叫廊桥的玩意儿。
人们从早上六点就开始吹这玩意了。

sentences.english: And on paper, at least, the new phone does only four new things.
sentences.chinese: 但报纸上说，这款新电话至少有四个玩意儿是新的。

sentences.english: That's a mantelpiece cluttered up with all kinds of doodad .
sentences.chinese: 那是个摆满了各种小玩意儿的壁炉架。

sentences.english: Knowing my father, I thought it could be just about anything.
sentences.chinese: 知父莫若女，我想肯定又是什么小玩意儿。

sentences.english: I'm gonna need a hand getting used to all these high-tech gadgets we have here.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一些帮助来熟悉这些高科技“玩意”。

sentences.english: They don’t even know what HDMI is.
sentences.chinese: 他们根本就不知道HDMI是个什么玩意儿。

sentences.english: Fret not, as we've got a whole 'nother round of laughs coming your way.
sentences.chinese: 别发愁了，我们为您带来了一款全新的有趣玩意儿。

sentences.english: He played nicknack on my sticks.
sentences.chinese: 在我的拐杖上摆弄他的小玩意儿。

sentences.english: Do you have an expensive shoe or gadget habit?
sentences.chinese: 你有买很贵的鞋子或者小玩意的习惯吗？

sentences.english: Tinker Bell's going to save us with her dopey little doohickeys .
sentences.chinese: 用小叮当的小玩意拯救大家吗？

sentences.english: Sure, we all know that Valentine's Day is a racket.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸置疑，大家都知道情人节是个骗钱的玩意儿。

sentences.english: Just look down your garbage bin, and you know what these people deal with on a daily basis.
sentences.chinese: 你就会怀疑这群人一天到晚看着这玩意怎么吃得下饭？

definition: erhua variant of 玩意[wan2 yi4]
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
auxiliary showing sth happened in the past
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
